pm1-emp101.speaker: Priya Patel
pm1-emp101.text: Anjali, your contribution to Project Phoenix has been outstanding, reflected in your exceptional Quality Score of 98. As your skills are perfectly aligned, a great next step would be for you to begin mentoring junior engineers on the team to help scale our ML capabilities.

pm1-emp101.speaker: HR Representative
pm1-emp101.text: Anjali, given your consistent high performance and expert status, we want to invest in your leadership trajectory. We recommend a mentorship role on a cross-functional initiative to give you exposure to broader product strategy, which will be a key step for your career growth here.

pm1-emp113.speaker: Priya Patel
pm1-emp113.text: Thanks for joining. I'm reviewing Brenda Garcia, who has one year of experience. I'm noting her project velocity is currently at 4.

pm1-emp113.speaker: Priya Patel
pm1-emp113.text: For Project Phoenix, we need C++ and Machine Learning. With 0% alignment, no skill overlap, and a clear gap in Python, this is not a fit.

pm1-emp113.speaker: HR Representative
pm1-emp113.text: Understood. Brenda's degree is in HR. Her strengths are in recruiting coordination, employee onboarding, and compliance reporting.

pm1-emp113.speaker: Priya Patel
pm1-emp113.text: Given the complete mismatch, let's re-scope her to an HR support role for the project and defer any technical Machine Learning training.
